meanings.definition: The act of directing something together with another person.
meanings.sent1: They worked in codirection to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The codirection of the team led to a successful outcome.
meanings.sent3: The codirection of the dance routine made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Their codirection was like two conductors leading a symphony.
meanings.sent5: The codirection of the ship by both captains ensured a safe voyage.

meanings.definition: The state of being directed together with another person.
meanings.sent1: She appreciated the codirection in making important decisions.
meanings.sent2: Their codirection in the play brought out the best in each actor.
meanings.sent3: The codirection of the traffic by the siblings was surprisingly efficient.
meanings.sent4: In their codirection, they navigated through challenges smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The codirection of the investigation by the detectives uncovered new leads.
